heading: Belial, Lord of Lies Boss Guide
content: Welcome to the Boss Guide. Here you will find all the information to gather Boss Lair Keys, summon the Boss, and successfully defeat it. can be summoned within the Palace of the Deceiver in the desert of Kehjistan. To challenge him, use the quick travel option by clicking the Palace of the Deceiver, or travel there normally using the Pay attention to the attacks used by ! The following section guides you through the boss's most dangerous abilities. slams his fist into the ground and swipes it across the entire platform, dealing high damage and knocking players back. prepares himself briefly before using a frontal beam from one side of the platform to the other and it deals devastating damage. Pools of Poison spawn underneath fists, and the player, dealing moderate damage over time while standing within its area of effect. Waves emerge from the Poisonous Pools, going left and right from the pools. These waves deal a large amount of damage. spawns multiple eyeballs facing different directions. After a brief moment, the eyeballs looking toward the platform create void zones in their line of sight, dealing significant damage over time. Before heading out, consider a quick stop at the to pick up elixirs to help counter his Each Boss has a different loot table of and cosmetic item(s), with a chance of dropping the highly sought-after items. How loot is distributed and rewarded has been changed with Season 8, and is now tied to using the Boss Lair Keys. To receive loot, you must use 2x to open the Hoard. You get these from killing the Ambush encounter version of . The Hoard has 2 items in Torment 1, granting one extra for each Torment difficulty increase, and 2 extra for Torment 4. You are guaranteed one boss-specific when you open a Hoard. You can increase this by 1 for doing Torment 3 or higher, and another 1 for being in a party. While in a party, you have a 33% chance of getting 1 additional class-specific item per party member. is that he does not have a loot table. Instead, you get to modify the loot that will drop from him when you open the Hoard. The options available are each of the bosses from the Boss Ladder. This Hoard will also contain one guaranteed Ancestral item. Use our to see what loot you can get from the different bosses. Most endgame builds use one of these items. Thankfully, the Boss ladder encounters have a greater chance of dropping them. This means you can focus on any boss that drops regular items you are looking to obtain or upgrade while still having a chance at a It is currently unknown if has an exclusive cosmetic reward when you defeat him. On rare occasions, ambushes you after defeating the other Boss Lair encounters in Diablo 4. This is an entirely different encounter compared to its Boss Lair counterpart. After defeating a Boss, a timer starts, and once finished, there is a chance for ' defeat, the loot available from the previous fight will drop as well as , which is required to loot the normal version of the encounter. spawns 1-2 crystals slowly moving toward the player. After 4 seconds, the crystals detonate where they are, dealing massive damage. creates a decoy of himself, using the same abilities as the real version. attacks with a frontal blast, dealing Poison damage in a straight line. traps the player within a deadly circle and summons multiple decoys that frequently mimic his attacks, aiming to overwhelm the player. launches poisonous blobs into the sky, which land in random nearby areas and deal moderate damage. Nangari adds have a chance to spawn from where the blobs land on the ground. Boss Guide covers everything you need to know about where to go, and how to complete this encounter. Reviewed by

You are guaranteed one boss-specific when you open a Hoard. You can increase this by 1 for doing Torment 3 or higher, and another 1 for being in a party. While in a party, you have a 33% chance of getting 1 additional class-specific item per party member. is that he does not have a loot table. Instead, you get to modify the loot that will drop from him when you open the Hoard. The options available are each of the bosses from the Boss Ladder. This Hoard will also contain one guaranteed Ancestral item. Use our to see what loot you can get from the different bosses. Most endgame builds use one of these items. Thankfully, the Boss ladder encounters have a greater chance of dropping them. This means you can focus on any boss that drops regular items you are looking to obtain or upgrade while still having a chance at a It is currently unknown if has an exclusive cosmetic reward when you defeat him. On rare occasions, ambushes you after defeating the other Boss Lair encounters in Diablo 4. This is an entirely different encounter compared to its Boss Lair counterpart. After defeating a Boss, a timer starts, and once finished, there is a chance for ' defeat, the loot available from the previous fight will drop as well as , which is required to loot the normal version of the encounter. spawns 1-2 crystals slowly moving toward the player. After 4 seconds, the crystals detonate where they are, dealing massive damage. creates a decoy of himself, using the same abilities as the real version. attacks with a frontal blast, dealing Poison damage in a straight line. traps the player within a deadly circle and summons multiple decoys that frequently mimic his attacks, aiming to overwhelm the player. launches poisonous blobs into the sky, which land in random nearby areas and deal moderate damage. Nangari adds have a chance to spawn from where the blobs land on the ground. Boss Guide covers everything you need to know about where to go, and how to complete this encounter. Reviewed by
